Author: Alright#0419

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you definitely need a node staking by block 100

Author: Alright#0419
Content: need to set it immediately to mine block 1

Author: Alright#0419
Content: wait for it to mine 2 blocks

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do `setgenerate false`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: follow to guide for the possplitter

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do `setgenerate true 1` on a *different* node

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then do `setgenerate true 0` on the node you used possplitter on

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then just leave it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you dont have to, it will just take a bit of time for blocks to be steady

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in any case for a 100% PoS coin, the initial distribution is CRITICAL

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so distributing the stake to 64+ people will allow the staking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the chain still works if all funds are concentrated into a few addresses, but that is really not a recommended state for a 100% PoS chain

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: hi getting errors of invalid block mined what is the reason behind this

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: block from another node got accepted in the network. hence, this block is invalid. if on 100% staked chain, after the first ~100 blocks, normal mining will show invalid block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as things are in sync and it is mining, you can ignore such errors

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you will get that on every chain regardless of POS %

Author: Alright#0419
Content: ignore it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's your node creating the invalid block btw @SHossain

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: which chain?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: CCNG?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: any chain

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I just mean when you see that error

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's your node mining an invalid block

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: oh...yes. that is correct

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not someone else's

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: someone elese mined a valid block and submitted, i mined the invalid

Author: Alright#0419
Content: doesn't have to do with someone else mining a block

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: ok. got you

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: thanks for clearing me up

Content: the PR I sent to Zcash will sit for weeks, while James usually merges things within minutes or hours. That is something that I really love about KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I saw this PR on Github, and that is why KMD has `size_on_disk`: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/3630

Content: granted, it was also easy to merge in. Sometimes a tiny tiny BTC feature requires changing 99 internals things, and it's not worth it. This was super easy

Author: TK#2921
Content:
Hi, I don't know if its the good channel but I've a question about dPOW. I understand that every ten minutes, the komodo blockchain is written on the bitcoin blockchain by the notary nodes so if you want to make a 51% attack, you need to overpower bitcoin. So here are my questions.
1. How (I mean technically) are the komodo blockchain written in the bitcoin blockchain?
2. How the bitcoin is queried by the komodo nodes to verify their chains? Must they run a bitcoin node alongside the komodo one?
3. How the proof in the bitcoin blockchain is known by the komodo nodes?
Thanks in advance for any answer.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1. with a notarization tx like: 773e6ee5705023bc1b37ffa4c6fbcfc85d21412ad3ab50e0454e7e281c4952b6

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 2. only the notary nodes need to run BTC to validate the notarizations, then write the validated data to the komodochain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 3. all the nodes look for the validated notarizations and update state

Author: TK#2921
Content: Thanks.  But what prevent me to make my own notarization, write them on the BTC chain, and do a classical 51% attack? As the nodes validates their komodochain using the validated notarization written in the komodochain, if I make my own notarization and include them in a forked komodochain, how will the attacked nodes react?

Author: TK#2921
Content: By the way, is there any notarization tx example?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you cant make a valid notarization tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: invalid notarizations are rejected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even if you could create a notarization tx, it would need to be valid, and if it is valid, then it is like a valid notarization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a notarization tx has 13 notary signatures, how do you suggest you will make them?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and like I said, since invalid notarizations are ignored, all you can do is make a valid notarization, even if you are able to make 13 notary signatures

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: did you look at the tx 773e6ee5705023bc1b37ffa4c6fbcfc85d21412ad3ab50e0454e7e281c4952b6 I listed above? that is a notarization tx

Author: TK#2921
Content:
So all the nodes have the list of all notary nodes? Where did they retrieve it?
Thanks for the tx do you have a BTC notarization tx as well?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: all tx here represents BTC notarization https://www.blocktrail.com/BTC/address/1P3rU1Nk1pmc2BiWC8dEy9bZa1ZbMp5jfg/transactions
